DataElement.preferredName: Scientific Publication Abstract Specified Sentence National Library of Medicine Medline Abstract Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A class of publication in which original scientific work is described.  The format usually includes an introduction in which relevant concepts are identified and the experimental system under study is presented, a section describing the experiments that were performed to test a specific hypothesis and the results and observations that were obtained, a section in which the results are discussed relative to findings by other investigators and the current state of knowledge in the field, and a section describing the experimental methods and procedures in sufficient detail to enable the reproduction of the work by independent investigators._A concept or idea not associated with any specific instance._Clearly and explicitly stated._A set of words that is complete in itself, conveying a statement, question, exclamation, or command and typically containing an explicit or implied subject and a predicate containing a finite verb._National Library of Medicine Medline_.A concept or idea not associated with any specific instance._Text; the words of something written
